Package tsp

Class TSPGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.UndirectedGraph
      • tsp.TSPGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph
    public class TSPGraph
extends UndirectedGraph
    The TSPGraph class extends the UndirectedGraph class. It implements additional methods regarding the update of pheromones of the various edges of the graph (read on Ant Colony Optimisation for solving the Travelling Salesman Problem).

    The pheromone level of each edge is stored in a n x n matrix where each entry (i,j) saves the pheromone level of the edge connecting node i and j. It also saves the best Hamiltonina Cycle found so far.

    See Also:
    UndirectedGraph, EvaporationEvent

    • Constructor Detail

      • TSPGraph

        public TSPGraph​(int n,
                java.util.List<int[]> info,
                double rho,
                double eta)
        Constructor for the TSPGraph objects.
        Parameters:
        n - number of vertices in the graph
        info - a list of integer arrays with three entries. Each entry of this array must contain the ID of the first vertex, the ID of the second vertex and the weight of the connection between the two, respectively.
        rho - Amount of pheromones evaporated by the edges after each evaporation
        eta - Average value of the exponential distribution of the time between each evaporation

    • Method Detail

      • getW

        public int getW()
        Computing the sum of the weight of all edges (W) is required for obtaining the amount of pheromones is to be laid down by an Ant once it completes one hamiltonian cycle (read on Ant Colony Optimisation for solving the Travelling Salesman Problem).
        Returns:
        W the sum of the weight of all edges in the graph

      • checkEdgeEvaporation

        public boolean checkEdgeEvaporation​(int id1,
                                    int id2)
        Checks if for the edge between the two vertices as already been scheduled or occurred an evaporation event.
        Parameters:
        id1 - identifier of the first vertex.
        id2 - identifier of the second vertex.
        Returns:
        true if for the edge connecting the two vertices has already been scheduled or occurred an evaporation event

      • layPheromones

        public void layPheromones​(int[] path,
                          double amount)
        Given a path with the visited vertices, this method adds the specified amount of pheromones to all edges belonging to this collection. The visited vertices are identified by their ID. For instance, let a path be {1,2,3}. This method lays down pheromones on the following edges: 1-2, 2-3.
        Parameters:
        path - an array containing the IDs of the visited vertices
        amount - the value of pheromones which is to added to all edges contained in the path array

      • getPathCost

        public int getPathCost​(int[] path)
        Given a path with the visited vertices, this method computes the sum of weight of all edges connecting these vertices. The visited vertices are identified by their ID. For instance, let a path be {1,2,3}. The method returns the sum of the cost of the following edges: 1-2, 2-3.
        Parameters:
        path - an array containing the IDs of the visited vertices
        Returns:
        the cost of all edges contained in the set of visited vertices

      • getEdgePheromones

        public double getEdgePheromones​(int id1,
                                int id2)
        Returns the pheromone level of the edge connecting the two vertices.

        The method returns -1 if the specified edge does not exist.

        Parameters:
        id1 - identifier of the first vertex
        id2 - identifier of the second vertex
        Returns:
        the pheromone level of the edge connecting the two vertices

      • decrementEdgePheromones

        public boolean decrementEdgePheromones​(int id1,
                                       int id2)
        Decrements pheromone level of the edge connecting the two vertices rho units
        Parameters:
        id1 - Start node id
        id2 - Finish node id
        Returns:
        true if the edege still has pheromones, false if its empty

      • getEta

        public double getEta()
        Returns eta value from the TSPGraph eta is the mean value of the exponential distribuiton used to simulate the time in which the edge pheromones are evaporated
        Returns:
        eta
